channel.title: Joe Buhlig
channel.description: leverage the digital and welcome real life

item.title: 16: I'm a Blue Person
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Fires all around. Joe adds to the list of people he blames for missed goals. Josh is not losing weight. And they both struggle with being real on the internet.
item.content:encoded: Fires all around. Joe adds to the list of people he blames for missed goals. Josh is not losing weight. And they both struggle with being real on the internet.

item.title: 5: A Beautiful Utopia of Input
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Joe goes to MacStock and sparks a discussion on the subject of conferences. Drew takes a deep dive into the strength of ‘Input’ and the helpful benefits of personality assessments. Also…Joe considers blacksmithing?
item.content:encoded: Joe goes to MacStock and sparks a discussion on the subject of conferences. Drew takes a deep dive into the strength of ‘Input’ and the helpful benefits of personality assessments. Also…Joe considers blacksmithing?

item.title: 15: Make The Bad Guy Relatable
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Josh doesn’t like sleeping and learned some things about writing without mental reserves. Joe rebranded the Guild and started pulling in content. And both of them digress on finances and chip cards.
item.content:encoded: Josh doesn’t like sleeping and learned some things about writing without mental reserves. Joe rebranded the Guild and started pulling in content. And both of them digress on finances and chip cards.

item.title: 31: The Power of a Positive No by William Ury
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Saying No. It’s something neither Mike nor Joe enjoy doing but know they need to embrace. The question is whether or not they can bring themselves to do it.
item.content:encoded: Saying No. It’s something neither Mike nor Joe enjoy doing but know they need to embrace. The question is whether or not they can bring themselves to do it.

item.title: 14: What Comes First?
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Are Josh and Joe trading places? And how does one go about marketing themselves without coming across as pushy? Also, they want to share more tidbits. So there’s more tidbits.
item.content:encoded: Are Josh and Joe trading places? And how does one go about marketing themselves without coming across as pushy? Also, they want to share more tidbits. So there’s more tidbits.

item.title: 4: Burn Energy, Gain Energy
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Joe gets a new computer, and the purchase sparks some discussion on the merits of the touch bar. It’s…good? Drew provides some iOS 11 note-taking updates, and brings up the topic of Twitter and the idea of meaningful distractions.
item.content:encoded: Joe gets a new computer, and the purchase sparks some discussion on the merits of the touch bar. It’s…good? Drew provides some iOS 11 note-taking updates, and brings up the topic of Twitter and the idea of meaningful distractions.

item.title: 13: Season 2 Goals
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Mike Schmitz joins Josh and Joe this round to discuss the new goals they’ve chosen for season two. Which is tricky since Josh started the show with only two goals.
item.content:encoded: Mike Schmitz joins Josh and Joe this round to discuss the new goals they’ve chosen for season two. Which is tricky since Josh started the show with only two goals.

item.title: Interview with Jay Miller on Productivity in Tech
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: As you can tell by my co-hosting of three different shows, I have embraced my love for podcasting. But, apparently, running three shows of my own isn’t enough. I started doing some interviews on other shows and the first of these to release is my chat with Jay Miller over...
item.content:encoded:
As you can tell by my co-hosting of three different shows, I have embraced my love for podcasting. But, apparently, running three shows of my own isn’t enough. I started doing some interviews on other shows and the first of these to release is my chat with Jay Miller over on the Productivity in Tech podcast.

Jay and I talk about a wide variety of topics involving my development work, how he should get into development, the work I’m kicking off on Productivity Guild, digital vs. analog task management, and a number of tangents around productivity in general. It’s a good time. You should check it out.

item.title: 30: The 5 Dysfunctions of a Team by Patrick Lencioni (with Josh Rensch)
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: This round Mike and Joe are joined by Joe’s other podcast co-host, Josh Rensch, to discuss the challenging dysfunctions that teams can be plagued by. It turns out that Josh has a rough backstory about his introduction to this book.
item.content:encoded: This round Mike and Joe are joined by Joe’s other podcast co-host, Josh Rensch, to discuss the challenging dysfunctions that teams can be plagued by. It turns out that Josh has a rough backstory about his introduction to this book.

item.title: 12: Season 1 Goals Post-Mortem
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: It’s the end of a season, which means Josh and Joe need to go through the last 12 weeks and review their progress. Some things went really well and others were a dumpster fire. But that’s to be expected.
item.content:encoded: It’s the end of a season, which means Josh and Joe need to go through the last 12 weeks and review their progress. Some things went really well and others were a dumpster fire. But that’s to be expected.

item.title: 3: Books Are Expensive
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Drew goes to the library, Joe gives an all-important nap update, and the two talk about note-taking habits, memorization, and task managers.
item.content:encoded: Drew goes to the library, Joe gives an all-important nap update, and the two talk about note-taking habits, memorization, and task managers.

item.title: 29: The Go-Getter by Peter Kyne
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Going after a task with unending motivation. This is something a go-getter has and that Joe and Mike struggled with.
item.content:encoded: Going after a task with unending motivation. This is something a go-getter has and that Joe and Mike struggled with.

item.title: 11: A Moral Dilemma
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Josh is full of requests this time. He also has a moral dilemma that Joe is unable to help with. But it’s at least interesting to consider.
item.content:encoded: Josh is full of requests this time. He also has a moral dilemma that Joe is unable to help with. But it’s at least interesting to consider.

item.title: 2: The Better Off These Things Get
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: WWDC 2017 is over, and a new iPad may or may not have been bought. Apple’s updates are discussed, along with the future of productivity and how tech like augmented reality and voice assistants might come into play.
item.content:encoded: WWDC 2017 is over, and a new iPad may or may not have been bought. Apple’s updates are discussed, along with the future of productivity and how tech like augmented reality and voice assistants might come into play.

item.title: 10: Single Character Variable Names
item.dc:creator: joe_buhlig
item.description: Joe has three thumbs up this week. It’s about time. Josh hates meetings but they both decide to contemplate their goals for the next round.
item.content:encoded: Joe has three thumbs up this week. It’s about time. Josh hates meetings but they both decide to contemplate their goals for the next round.
